question: Who was Chairman of the UN Committee, meant for inspecting places in Iraq for finding nuclear weapons during Saddam Husseinâ€™s regime?
explanation: The Bush administration began a military buildup in the region, and after pushing hard gained passage of UN Security Council Resolution 1441. It was led by Hans Blix, Head of the United Nations Monitoring, Verification and Inspection Commission (UNMOVIC) and Mohamed El Baradei Director General of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), the Resolution brought weapons inspectors back to Iraq in November 2002.
